org.orgName: United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON- NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. BAIL BOND.

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS that we, Francis Stephen Medcraf as principal and M. M. Null and Nell J. Null, El Michael J Michael as suretie, all Seattle Wash. are held and firmly bound unto THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA for the use and benefit of any person entitled thereto, in the sum of FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($500) lawful money of these United States, for the payment of which well and truly to be made, we hereby bind ourselves, our and eahc of our heirs, executors and adminstrators, jointly and severally, firmly by these presents.
Given under our hands this 11th day of June A.D. 1915. THE CONDITION of this obligation is such that, Whereas;

The above bounden Francis Stephen Medcraf has been arrested upon a warrant issued by Reah M. Whitehead, a Justice of the Peace of the State of Washington, charging him with practicing dentistry without a license so to do, at Seattle, King County, Washington, and was, on June 9th, 1915, convicted of said offense and sentenced to pay a fine of $50.00 and costs amounting to $8.90 and to stand committed to the county Jail of said county until such fine and costs are paid at the rate of $3.00 per day for each day of such imprisonment; and whereas

The said Francis Stephen Medcraf has amplied to the United States District Court above named for a writ of Habeas Corpus to inquire into the matter aforesaid and the imprisonment of the said Francis Stephen Medcraf undedr the commitment issued upon such judgement and conviction, alleging that his imprisonment thereunder is illegal as being in contravention of the Constitution of the United States and of the State of Washington, and a Writ of Habeas Corpus has been duly issues by said United States District Court upon said petition and the said applicant has been brought before the Court preliminary to the hearing of said Writ and is now before said Court and the hearing thereof has been fixed for Monday, June 14th 1915 at 10 o'clock A.M. and the bail of said petitioner has been by said court fixed at $500.00;

NOW THEREFORE, if the said Francis Stephen Medcraf shall and does at all times render himself amenable to the process of said Court during the pendency of said proceedings and to such as may be issued to enforce the judgement that may be rendered therein and shall be and appear at such times and places as the Court may direct in said matter and otherwise abide the order or judgement that the court may make therein, then this obligation to be void, else of full force and virtue.
Witness our hands this 11th day of June A.D. 1915. (signatures on next page)
Francis Stephen Medcraf. Principal M. M. Null Nell Johnson Null his wife E. Michael. Leomie J Michael his wife Sureties.
State of Washington as County of King

Be it known that on this 11th day June A.D. 1915, before me personally same M.M. Null and Nell J. Null his wife, E Michael and Leomie J Michael his wife, all of Seattle, King County, Washington, who being first duly sworn do say; that they are the indivuals named in and who executed the foregoing bond; that they are residents and qualified electors of the State of Washington and worth the sum of Five Hundred Dollars each, over and above their just debts and liabilities and exclusive of property exempt from sale on execution. M.M. Null Nell Johnson Null E. Michael Leomie J Michael
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th day of June A.D. 1915. Geo D. Emery Notary Public for Washington Residing in Seattle.
